Package node

Class Node

java.lang.Object
node.Node
public class Node extends Object
A Node represents a peer, a cooperating member within a network following this Quorum-based blockchain protocol as implemented here. This node participates in a distributed and decentralized network protocol, and achieves this by using some of the following architecture features: Quorum Consensus DSA authentication Blockchain using SHA-256 Multithreading Servant Model Stateful Model TCP/IP communication Beware, any methods below are a WIP

      public Node(Config configValues, int port)
      Constructs a Node and initiates a server socket to accept connections.

      port - Port number on which the node will listen for connections.

      public void requestConnections(ArrayList<Address> globalPeers)
      Attempts to establish connections with a specified number of nodes from a list of global peers.
      Parameters:
      globalPeers - List of global peers to connect to.

    • gossipTransaction

      public void gossipTransaction(Transaction transaction)
      Gossips a transaction to the network.
      Parameters:
      transaction - The transaction to gossip.

    • addTransaction

      public void addTransaction(Transaction transaction)
      Adds a transaction to the mempool after validation and gossiping.
      Parameters:
      transaction - The transaction to add.

    • sendQuorumReady

      public void sendQuorumReady()
      Sends a quorum ready signal to a list of quorum peers.

    • receiveQuorumReady

      public void receiveQuorumReady(ObjectOutputStream oout, ObjectInputStream oin)
      Receives and processes a quorum ready signal from a peer.
      Parameters:
      oout - Output stream to send a response.
      oin - Input stream to receive the signal.

    • sendMempoolHashes

      public void sendMempoolHashes()
      Sends the hash values of the transactions in the mempool to a quorum of peers, allowing them to request missing transactions.

    • receiveMempoolHashes

      public void receiveMempoolHashes(Set<String> keys, ObjectOutputStream oout, ObjectInputStream oin)
      Receives the hash values of transactions from a peer, identifies missing transactions in the local mempool, and requests the missing transactions.
      Parameters:
      keys - Set of hash values representing transactions in the mempool.
      oout - Output stream to send a response.
      oin - Input stream to receive the signal.

    • constructBlock

      public void constructBlock()
      Constructs a block from the transactions in the mempool, validates the transactions, and initiates the process of obtaining signatures from the quorum.

    • sendQuorumSignature

      public void sendQuorumSignature()
      Signs the hash of the constructed block and sends the signature to the quorum. Invoked after constructing a block.

    • receiveQuorumSignature

      public void receiveQuorumSignature(BlockSignature signature)
      Receives quorum signatures, verifies them, and processes them to reach consensus on the block. Invoked after receiving signatures from a quorum of peers.
      Parameters:
      signature - The signature of the block hash.

    • tallyQuorumSigs

      public void tallyQuorumSigs()
      Tallies the received quorum signatures, determines the winning hash, and adds the block to the blockchain if consensus is reached. Invoked after receiving all signatures from the quorum.

    • sendSkeleton

      public void sendSkeleton()
      Constructs a BlockSkeleton from the current quorum block and signatures, then sends it to the local group of peers. Invoked after constructing a block and obtaining quorum signatures.

    • sendSkeleton

      public void sendSkeleton(BlockSkeleton skeleton)
      Sends a pre-constructed BlockSkeleton to the local group of peers. Invoked when receiving a BlockSkeleton from another node.
      Parameters:
      skeleton - The pre-constructed BlockSkeleton to be sent.

    • receiveSkeleton

      public void receiveSkeleton(BlockSkeleton blockSkeleton)
      Receives a BlockSkeleton from another node, validates the signatures, and adds the corresponding block to the blockchain if validations succeed.
      Parameters:
      blockSkeleton - The received BlockSkeleton.

    • constructBlockWithSkeleton

      public Block constructBlockWithSkeleton(BlockSkeleton skeleton)
      Constructs a new block using the transactions specified in the given BlockSkeleton. Invoked after receiving a valid BlockSkeleton from another node.
      Parameters:
      skeleton - The BlockSkeleton containing transaction details.
      Returns:
      The constructed Block.

    • addBlock

      public void addBlock(Block block)
      Adds a block to the blockchain, updates the merkle root hash, and alerts the wallet if applicable. Also triggers the next quorum readiness check.
      Parameters:
      block - The block to be added.

    • sendOneWayMessageQuorum

      public void sendOneWayMessageQuorum(Message message)
      Sends a one-way message to all nodes in the current quorum, excluding itself.
      Parameters:
      message - The message to be sent.

    • inQuorum

      public boolean inQuorum()
      Checks whether the current node is a member of the quorum.
      Returns:
      True if the node is in the quorum, otherwise false.

    • inQuorum

      public boolean inQuorum(Block block)
      Checks whether the current node is a member of the quorum for a specific block.
      Parameters:
      block - The block for which to check the quorum.
      Returns:
      True if the node is in the quorum, otherwise false.
